Package CIT2_Explanations

Class ExplainableCentroid

java.lang.Object
CIT2_Explanations.ExplainableCentroid
public class ExplainableCentroid
extends java.lang.Object
Class that contains all the data required to build the explanation for the centroid

  • Constructor Details

    • ExplainableCentroid

      public ExplainableCentroid​(generic.Tuple centroid_interval, intervalType2.sets.IntervalT2MF_Interface fired_fou, java.util.LinkedList<Pair<CIT2,​RuleExplanation>> left_endpoint_explanation, java.util.LinkedList<Pair<CIT2,​RuleExplanation>> right_endpoint_explanation, type1.sets.T1MF_Interface min_es, type1.sets.T1MF_Interface max_es, generic.Output output)
      Constructor for the explanation
      Parameters:
      centroid_interval - The centroid value
      fired_fou - The fired FOU
      left_endpoint_explanation - List with the consequent CIT2 that contributed to the left endpoint and the rule used in their inferencing
      right_endpoint_explanation - List with the consequent CIT2 that contributed to the right endpoint and the rule used in their inferencing
      min_es - AES that determines the left endpoint
      max_es - AES that determines the right endpoint
      output - The output variable this centroid value refers to

    • ExplainableCentroid

      public ExplainableCentroid​(generic.Tuple interval_centroid)
      Constructor used when the explanation is not requested. Only the interval centroid value is stored
      Parameters:
      interval_centroid - The interval centroid value

  • Method Details

    • printableExplanation

      public java.lang.String printableExplanation()
      Function that organizes all the information of the current object in a printable string
      Returns:
      The string containing the explanation for the current centroid

    • addRuleExplaination

      private void addRuleExplaination​(Pair<CIT2,​RuleExplanation> current_rule, java.lang.StringBuffer text_explanation)
      Adds the explanation of a single rule to build the final explanation returned by printFirings
      Parameters:
      current_rule - The current rule and explanation to add to the final explanation
      text_explanation - The explanation built so far to which the explanation of the current rule will be added

    • plotEmbeddedSets

      public void plotEmbeddedSets()
      Plots the AES that determined the centroid value in intervalCentroid

    • plotAESGeneration

      public void plotAESGeneration()
      Functions that plots different steps in the generation of the AES determining the endpoints of the constrained centroid.

    • AESGenerationPlotting

      private void AESGenerationPlotting​(CIT2[] output_partitioning, boolean isLeftAES)
      Handles the plotting of the generation of one of the AES determining the enpdoints
      Parameters:
      output_partitioning - The CIT2 sets partitioning the output variable
      isLeftAES - True if the generation for the AES determining the left endpoint needs to be generated. False if it is for the AES determining the right endpoint

    • getOutputPartitioning

      private java.util.List<CIT2> getOutputPartitioning()
      Returns the CIT2 sets partitioning the output variable
      Returns:
      A List with the sets partitioning the output variable

    • getFiredAES

      private type1.sets.T1MF_Interface[] getFiredAES​(CIT2[] output_partitioning, boolean isLeftExplanation)
      For each of the CIT2 partitioning the output, selects one of its AES and applies the inference operator on it
      Parameters:
      output_partitioning - The CIT2 sets partitioning the output variable
      isLeftExplanation - True if the generation for the AES determining the left endpoint needs to be generated. False if it is for the AES determining the right endpoint
      Returns:
      The selected T1 AES of the input CIT2 sets after the inference

    • findExplanation

      private Pair<CIT2,​RuleExplanation> findExplanation​(CIT2 set, java.util.LinkedList<Pair<CIT2,​RuleExplanation>> explanations)
      Finds the rule and the explanation used to do the inference on the CIT2 set passed as an input
      Parameters:
      set - The set for which the rule and explanation is required
      explanations - The List of all the explanations
      Returns:
      The RuleExplanation for the current set
